#Remote Teams: Define a communication policy so Slack doesn't kill you
https://t.co/JIJilcS3iU
@hfauq Oh yes, that needs a different medium! GitHub PRs are a good medium for tech teams, and/or Google Doc + Comment feature for concept.
@hfauq I also had good experience using Trello Cards, which is roughly the same (Specification of Feature + Discussion).
I agree 100%, that it's impossible to use Slack for  "documentation" purposes. https://t.co/mXdhtuhVqq
@hfauq A chat flow / discussion is rarely a good source of truth. The concise summary you create afterwards is. That's why I like having spec docs.
@hfauq Does Twist offer this "Here is the result of this thread" feature (pinned post in Discourse)?

Ethical behavior of leaders is highly correlated to employee happiness. Be awesome to everyone! https://t.co/hHoQcHAsgF
@c089 Happy to hear! Have a nice one!
@c089 Yes, that would be great. But in my experience, most people do want freedom but not responsibility. Being an entrepreneur is tough.
German introduction to intend-based leadership: https://t.co/1x1MJYTUeX

@c089 It's also that they have been conditioned to go for the least risky option for years.
So, just fixing the environment gets you only so far.
@c089 Think about the choices they had to make in order to reach their current positions, and what kind of behavior these supported.

@c089 They are diametral to what autonomous teams need. 
I see so many people never making a choice alone, but always in teams, ‚Ä¶

@c089 because then noone is to blame.
Boldness (not the one where you are an asshole) strips you from your safety net and exposes you personally.
@c089 Not on a financial level (esp. in DE where it's hard to fire people) but on a far more powerful level: recognition within you peer group.

@c089 @rradczewski @AnnNat @dzappold Absolutely, why would you pay someone that says:
Do this.
Or do that.
Your choice!
Because: CHOICE OMGWTF!

@haraball @c089 @rradczewski @AnnNat @dzappold Because these choices affect only you, personally. 
In an organization you have so much more options, and effects.

@c089 That's why it's so hard to change.
Teams are part of an org,
orgs are part of a market+country ‚Ä¶
You have layers and layers broken around.

@haraball @c089 @rradczewski @AnnNat @dzappold Become agile turns your org upside down, many fail because they don't acknowledge that.
It's easier to start with building entirely new orgs
@g33konaut Alle Startups so.
@realn2s Wouldn't this be an echo chamber?

@Singsalad I've seen roughly similar roadblocks on the superficial level: Diversity is a choice, and in an established organization a more riskier one.
@Singsalad You risk reaching short term goals because hiring someone who is not neurological similar has a higher chance for friction.
@Singsalad So you need to give ppl incentives. At a client I worked with the Diversity rate was made part of an MDs performance evaluation.
@Singsalad It's the same with any change. Finding a way to pull people into a different mindset is key. This is done by leading the change from top.
@Singsalad Some form of carrot on a stick needs to be there ...

I'm refactoring an Angular 1 app to React and I really love the fact that it gets rid of all the Angular Magic.

Sven Thiele from @Cofinpro_AG talks about digital transformation in the asset management sector. @WTM_Frankfurt https://t.co/ovoiOSyT7I

Digitalization happens in all financial service areas: payment, lending and investment. 
First noticable effect: job cuts.
Banks lack brand power and skills to successfully transform their operations as well as the sense of urgency. They are still doing too well.

A "quick" and agile time to market working with a bank: 9 months. 
But banks are ready to experiment and fail. Iteration is the key!

"We hired our first female developer!" 
Sad clap.

It's so great to just get rid of all the scope stuff. 
Handling forms (errors, validation) is so much better AND pluggable.
Jure Zakotnik talks about the learnings @KfW becoming digital: https://t.co/95169sjZHp
@NativeWired I have so much respect for the first women to join any male-only team!
In Scandinavia you can stream movies which have just opened in cinemas: https://t.co/FubtyjTmkc
KfW uses design thinking workshops which moves people out of silos to develop new ideas with a clear and cross-functional customer focus.
But before they start: top-level management must sign a letter that they won't interfere with the workshop.
... because they only wanted to have people working on ideas that benefits *their* department.

Innovation Labs are not earning money right now. @jzakotnik recommends to have an eye on publicity!
https://t.co/DuDb31Sst0 @WTM_Frankfurt
@NativeWired I think many teams are very mature and professional so it's great that you made this experience.

"The hard part is people, not software."
Claudia St√ºtzel, CIO of @dbsystel talks about their digitalization efforts @WTM_Frankfurt. https://t.co/t9UThcfbzb

Our first efforts failed, because we could not change the underlying system. 
We had new tools, but the old mindset.
What we did then is, top-level management gave the strategic decisions to be made to the employees.
Interestingly the responses and solutions were not the most important. But that employees took the responsibility.
And this changed their mindset.
This the vision that drives @dbsystel's transformation: https://t.co/RP13j6cCTt

Michael Beckmann ads some food for thought on transformation of organizations. @WTM_Frankfurt 
10 regular mistakes coming up: https://t.co/W2xRKqFCHg

1 People can't be changed, influence them.
2 Failing to identify problems correctly.
3 Underestimating psychological effects of change.

On 2: https://t.co/mvtkQHYser
4 Disregard of timeshifts in effects
5 misunderstanding of learning vs. *unlearning* (again: behavior!)
6 Underestimating group think, biases, politics, conformity pressure, not invented here syndrome, silent majorities

7 Ignoring "Immunity to change" (expressed behavior vs. actual behavior)
8 Change not applied in the whole organization

Ambidexterity: keep different organizational approaches under one roof.
9 Ask better questions! And don't fail to answer the truthfully!

10 Innovations don't need benchmarks, be unique!
tldr pictured: https://t.co/CvXA36Eu4A
